I believe campus is safe but look out for poles; they tend to jump out in front of you if you're not looking where you are going :)
There is no Greek life here that I've noticed.
NMSU-A is great for those students who are going to college for the first time. Classes are smaller and works hand in hand with students.
Absolutely nothing. I have not noticed any clubs meeting up and Alamogordo is an extremely small town with a lot of military coming and going.
Nmsu-a doesn't have good food on campus so everyone has to go else where for food but it's within a ten minute drive to find somewhere to eat.
NMSU-A doesn't have dorms. Most students room with other people In houses or apartments.
The professors know what they're talking about.
Find your classes before the first day. It'll help reduce anxiety and the typical freshman I don't know where I'm going expression

The professors are extremely helpful and nice. This is my first semester in college ever and all of the professors that I've asked for help, they are extremely willing to help out in any possible way. Even the students are down to earth.

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Bang for the buck this is a good campus for getting your general education requirements out of the way. it is only a community college branch of nmsu which most people don't realize. What to do for fun i love to play board games with my husband and friends. just hanging out and watching tv or movies is fun too. Food and Dining i have not dined on campus, but i am sure it is fine. Tips for prospective students you must be dedicated if you plan on taking online courses. otherwise, you may really struggle to keep up. In three sentences the only courses i've taken were online so i can't give a campus review. i really loved my human biology class. i plan to transfer to the main campus in las cruces this summer to pursue a bachelor of science in biochemistry, but will still be taking some lower level courses online or on campus here in alamogordo. Login to rate or flag the reviews Erin from Tularosa, NM
